ygData.subject: RE: Use for Lullaby at L17...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I had nearly the same experience in Highpass on the other side with gnolls 3 days ago.  Same as you I nodded them all, but several kept right on attacking.
ygData.messageBody:
>From: "RaceFace" <bean@...>
>I've been noticing this in Highpass fighting orcs.
>We're all attacking the same mob, so I Lullbay them. (if we get a massive
>spawn). I count the nods, and sure enough, all the mobs are lulled.
>Obviously the one we're attackig doesn't stay lulled, but neither do some
>other ones, even though they've got the nod message showing them as being
>sleeping, and keep getting it displayed. No one is attacking them either,
>no AE spells, etc.

>Frustrating, to say the least. Reduces my crowd control ability immensely.
>-Gaelaian Galaenor
>-Pondering bard of the 20th song
>-Tunare.

I had nearly the same experience in Highpass on the other side with gnolls 3
days ago. Same as you I nodded them all, but several kept right on
attacking. Our enchanter after seeing this twice exclaimed, "Hold on I'll
area mez them, haven't they fixed that damn bard song yet?" To which I
promptly /rofl'd. I added "Don't worry, when they do it'll probably be:

A gnoll soothsayer nods to sleep
a gnoll soothsayer says "Its wood elves like you that ruined your
own lands, you'll not ruin
mine!"
a gnoll soothsayer nods in agreement
a gnoll brawler nods in agreement
a volunteer Delyn_00 nods in agreement

Doh!

Kitasi
